newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still speculative buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still speculative buy.

text.p: -- Credit Lyonnais Securities said it is maintaining its speculative buy recommendation on stock of Brazilian state-owned electrical utility Cesp and raising its earnings estimates for the firm.
-- "Improving fundamentals and prospective privatization are driving the share price," the bank said in a research report.
-- Moreover, the firm's debt risk is expected to decline sharply by 1997.
-- Although Cesp, owned by Sao Paulo state, is last on the state's privatization list, it will improve its debt-equity ratio with the state's sale of power firm CPFL and operating power plants.

-- Credit Lyonnais said it revised earnings estimates for Cesp to 3.24 reais per 1,000 shares from 1.75 reais form 1996, to 7.27 reais from 6.34 reais in 1997 and to 9.38 reais from 8.75 reais in 1998.
-- The bank said it projects net income for Cesp of 303 million reais in 1996, 680 reais for 1997 and 878 million reais in 1998.
-- Cesp posted first-half inflation-adjusted net income of 157.6 million reais, or 1.68 reais per 1,000 shares, it said.
